title: Fix Skip button and Ongoing badge text truncation with large text
Push branch to remote repository
description:
Push the feature branch to the remote repository after all tests pass.

**Prerequisites:**
- All implementation tasks completed
- All tests passing (npm run precommit succeeded)

**Command:** git push origin feature/end-ongoing-episode

**Success criteria:**
- Branch successfully pushed to remote
- No git errors or conflicts
- Branch visible on GitHub: https://github.com/vfilby/migralog/tree/feature/end-ongoing-episode

**If push fails:**
- Check for upstream changes: git fetch origin main
- Resolve any conflicts if necessary
- Re-run precommit tests if code was modified
- Retry push

**Note:** This must succeed before creating the pull request.

title: Follow-up medication reminders only work when app is in foreground
description: Follow-up reminders (30 minutes after initial notification) are only scheduled when the app receives the notification while in the foreground. If the user receives the initial medication reminder while the app is backgrounded or closed, no follow-up reminder is scheduled. This is because the scheduleFollowUpReminder() method is only called in the addNotificationReceivedListener handler (notificationService.ts:312-359), which only fires for foreground notifications. The follow-up scheduling needs to be moved to a different location that works regardless of app state.

title: Fix medication notifications triggering after early dose
description: Notifications should not fire if medication was already logged before the scheduled time. GitHub issue #49

title: Update CLAUDE.md documentation
description:
Update project documentation to reflect ULID usage.

File: CLAUDE.md

Changes needed:
1. Document ID generation approach
2. Add ULID to tech stack
3. Document testing patterns for ULID mocks
4. Add migration notes (for future reference)

Example addition:
```markdown
## ID Generation

The app uses ULID (Universally Unique Lexicographically Sortable Identifier) for all database IDs.

**Library:** `ulidx` with `react-native-get-random-values` polyfill

**Format:** 26-character Base32 string (e.g., `01ARZ3NDEKTSV4RRFFQ69G5FAV`)

**Benefits:**
- 128-bit with 80 bits cryptographic randomness
- Lexicographically sortable (timestamp-based)
- Compact and URL-safe
- Cloud sync ready

**Testing:** Use mock utilities in testHelpers.ts for deterministic tests
```
acceptance_criteria:
- CLAUDE.md includes ULID documentation
- Tech stack section updated
- Testing guidance added
- Migration notes documented

title: Run precommit checks and verify build
description:
Execute all precommit checks to ensure the ULID migration is production-ready.

Commands:
```bash
cd app
npm run precommit
```

This runs:
- ESLint with zero warnings
- TypeScript type checking
- Full test suite with coverage

Additional manual checks:
1. Test iOS build: `npm run ios`
2. Test Android build: `npm run android`
3. Verify app launches without errors
4. Create a few test records to verify ULID generation
5. Check ULID format in database (should be 26 chars)

Look for:
- No TypeScript errors
- No lint warnings
- All tests pass
- App builds successfully
- IDs are proper ULID format
acceptance_criteria:
- npm run precommit passes with 0 errors/warnings
- iOS build succeeds
- Android build succeeds
- App launches and generates valid ULIDs
- Manual testing shows IDs are 26-character ULIDs

title: Create PR and close GitHub issue #18
description:
Create pull request for ULID migration and link to GitHub issue.

PR Title: "feat: Migrate to ULID for all database IDs"

PR Description should include:
- Summary of changes
- Why ULID was chosen (security, cloud-sync ready, sortable)
- Libraries added (ulidx, react-native-get-random-values)
- Test coverage status
- Migration impact (none - pre-production)
- Link to issue #18

Checklist:
- [ ] Create feature branch: `feature/ulid-migration`
- [ ] Commit all changes
- [ ] Push to remote
- [ ] Create PR via gh pr create
- [ ] Reference "Fixes #18" in PR description
- [ ] Verify CI checks pass
- [ ] Request review if needed

After merge:
- Close Beads epic MigraineTracker-2
- Verify GitHub issue #18 auto-closed
acceptance_criteria:
- PR created and linked to issue #18
- All CI checks pass
- PR description is comprehensive
- GitHub issue #18 closes when PR merges
notes: IMPORTANT: Do not create PR until all implementation, testing, documentation, and verification tasks are 100% complete. This is the final step after everything else is done and working.

title: Test infrastructure enhancements and improvements
description:
Follow-up improvements identified during the comprehensive test coverage work (PR #212).

These enhancements will improve test maintainability, security, and coverage:

High Priority:
- Add build-time exclusion for test helpers in production (security)

Medium Priority:  
- Fix or document skipped tests in BackupRecoveryScreen
- Add integration tests for critical user flows

Low Priority:

- Standardize Alert.alert testing patterns across all tests

These are non-blocking improvements that can be addressed incrementally.

title: Improve sparkline gradient background styling
description:
The transparent gradient background in IntensitySparkline provides useful scale context, but the current style could be improved. Currently uses 15% opacity gradient with pain scale colors (greenâ†’purple).

Current implementation in IntensitySparkline.tsx:
- LinearGradient with 11 color stops from PAIN_SCALE
- stopOpacity="0.15" for subtlety
- Renders as background behind the sparkline path

Need to explore alternative visual approaches that maintain the scale indication while improving aesthetics.
design:
Potential approaches to consider:

1. **Adjust opacity**: Try different opacity levels (10%, 20%, 25%) to find better balance
2. **Different gradient style**: 
   - Use fewer color stops (just key pain levels: mild, moderate, severe)
   - Add gradient blur/feathering for smoother transitions
   - Try radial gradient instead of linear
3. **Alternative visual indicators**:
   - Subtle horizontal bands/zones instead of gradient
   - Faded grid lines at pain level thresholds
   - Subtle texture or pattern overlay
4. **Color adjustments**:
   - Desaturate the gradient colors
   - Use single-color gradient with varying intensity
   - Match theme colors more closely

File to modify: src/components/IntensitySparkline.tsx (lines 106-129)

title: Remove superfluous follow-up notification after medication is logged
description: Currently when a medication is logged from a notification action, a follow-up notification is sent confirming it has been logged. This is unnecessary and should be removed.

title: Enable time-sensitive notifications for medication reminders
description: Medication reminders should use time-sensitive notification priority so they still display even when the user is in a focus mode. This ensures critical medication reminders are not missed.

title: Fix dashboard not updating after logging medication from notification
description: After logging a medication from a notification action, the dashboard doesn't show the medication as logged until something triggers a re-render (like navigating to a sub page and back). The dashboard should immediately reflect the updated state.

title: Add configurable follow-up reminder with critical alert sound
description: Add an optional 30-minute follow-up reminder if the user hasn't taken action (neither dismissed nor logged as taken). This reminder should use critical alert sound that plays even when the phone is silenced.
design: Requires iOS critical alerts entitlement. Will need to request special permission from Apple. The follow-up reminder should be configurable per medication or globally.

description:

- Time-sensitive notifications (on/off)

- Critical alert sound for follow-ups (on/off)
- Confirmation notifications (on/off)

Settings should be accessible from both the Settings screen (global defaults) and individual medication detail screens (per-medication overrides).

title: BackupRecoveryScreen.tsx: improve from 28.88% to >70% coverage
Migrate from timestamp-based IDs to ULID
description:
Replace the current home-grown ID generation (Date.now() + Math.random()) with ULID (Universally Unique Lexicographically Sortable Identifier) to support future cloud sync, improve security, and use industry-standard identifiers.

Context:
- Current: `${Date.now()}-${Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9)}`
- Target: ULID (128-bit, 26-character Base32 string)
- Benefits: Cryptographically secure, sortable, cloud-sync ready, compact
- Library: ulidx + react-native-get-random-values polyfill

Scope:
- 10 database tables with ID columns
- ~9 calls to generateId() across repositories
- All tests need updating for deterministic ULID mocks
- Migration strategy (none needed - pre-production)

title: Improve ongoing episode card styling on dashboard
description:
The ongoing episode card on the dashboard needs better visual treatment to indicate it requires attention:

3. Add the "Ongoing" badge that appears on the episode detail page
4. Current state: Takes up too much space and doesn't clearly indicate it needs attention
5. Reference: Episode detail page has good "Ongoing" badge example

title: Separate episode end and edit time logic in EpisodeDetailScreen
description:
The current endEpisodeWithCustomTime function handles both ending ongoing episodes and editing end times of completed episodes. This makes the code confusing and violates single responsibility principle.

**Current issue:** 
- Function name suggests it only ends episodes but also edits existing end times
- Conditional logic based on episode.endTime state is hard to follow
- Mixed responsibilities in one function

**Solution:**
- Create separate functions: endEpisodeWithCustomTime and editEpisodeEndTime
- Clear naming that matches function purpose
- Separate the conditional logic into distinct code paths
- Update handleEpisodeEndLongPress to call appropriate function based on context

**Files to modify:**
- app/src/screens/EpisodeDetailScreen.tsx (lines 604-612)

**Reference:**
Code review comment: https://github.com/vfilby/migralog/pull/211#discussion_r2556637025

Daily status Clear notification action doesn't work when app is killed
description: When the user taps Clear on the daily check-in notification while the app is killed or in background, the action doesn't work. Root cause: dailyCheckinService.initialize() doesn't call getLastNotificationResponseAsync() to retrieve pending responses.
design: Add getLastNotificationResponseAsync() call in dailyCheckinService.initialize() similar to notificationService

title: Medication reminder shows even when medication was already logged
description: When medication is logged before scheduled reminder time, the notification still fires. Root cause: logDose() only dismisses presented notifications, doesn't cancel scheduled ones.
design: Cancel scheduled notification via notification_id when logging dose

title: Extract common test fixtures to reduce duplication
description:
Navigation and route mocks are duplicated across multiple test files. This should be extracted to shared test utilities.

Current duplication pattern found in multiple test files:
const mockNavigation = {
  navigate: jest.fn(),
  goBack: jest.fn(),
  setOptions: jest.fn(),
  addListener: jest.fn(() => jest.fn()),
};

Recommendation:
1. Create testUtils/fixtures.ts
2. Export createMockNavigation() and createMockRoute() functions
3. Update all test files to use the shared fixtures
4. Consider other commonly duplicated mocks (themes, stores, etc.)

Benefits:
- Reduced code duplication
- Easier to maintain test infrastructure
- Consistent mock behavior across tests

title: Add ability to end ongoing episodes
description:
Implement UI to allow users to set end time for ongoing episodes. Currently there's no way to end an ongoing episode from the edit screen.

**GitHub Issue:** #39

**Approach:**
Add "End Episode" button to EpisodeDetailScreen that:
- Appears only for ongoing episodes (end_time is null)
- Opens date/time picker defaulting to current time
- Allows user to adjust end time before confirming
- Saves end_time and transitions episode to completed status

**Files to modify:**
- app/src/screens/EpisodeDetailScreen.tsx - Add UI for ending episode
- app/src/store/episodeStore.ts - Add endEpisode action
- app/src/database/episodeRepository.ts - Verify updateEpisode handles end_time

**Reference implementation:**
- See how date/time pickers are used in NewEpisodeScreen
- Follow theme system patterns (light/dark mode support)
- Use existing UI components and styling patterns
acceptance_criteria:
- "End Episode" button appears only for ongoing episodes
- Date/time picker defaults to current time but is adjustable
- Episode end_time is set and persisted to database
- Episode status changes from ongoing to completed
- UI updates immediately to reflect completed status
- Supports both light and dark mode
- All existing tests pass (npm run precommit)
- New functionality has test coverage
- Branch pushed to remote: git push origin feature/end-ongoing-episode
- PR created: gh pr create --base main --title 'feat: add ability to end ongoing episodes' --body 'Closes #39'

- Add lint rule or test guideline to enforce consistency

title: Critical notifications not working - requires Apple entitlement
description: Critical notifications are configured in the code but won't work without the com.apple.developer.usernotifications.critical-alerts entitlement from Apple. The code attempts to use critical: true and interruptionLevel: 'critical' for follow-up reminders (notificationService.ts:875-883) but these settings have no effect without the proper entitlement. Need to either: 1) Apply for the critical alerts entitlement from Apple at https://developer.apple.com/contact/request/notifications-critical-alerts-entitlement/, or 2) Remove the critical alert code and use a different approach for important follow-up reminders.

title: Add long press editing for episode end timeline event
description:
Add long press functionality to the 'Episode Ended' timeline event in EpisodeDetailScreen to allow users to:

1. **Edit end time** - Adjust when the episode ended using a date/time picker
2. **Reopen episode** - Remove the end time to make the episode ongoing again

**Implementation Details:**
- Add handleEpisodeEndLongPress function similar to existing long press handlers
- Show ActionSheet with options: 'Cancel', 'Edit End Time', 'Reopen Episode' 
- Use existing episodeStore.updateEpisode function for updates
- Follow patterns established by other timeline event editors
- Support both iOS ActionSheet and Android Alert patterns

**User Flow:**
- Long press on 'Episode Ended' timeline event
- Choose 'Edit End Time': Opens date/time picker with current end time
- Choose 'Reopen Episode': Confirms action then sets endTime to null
- UI updates immediately to reflect changes

**Files to modify:**
- src/screens/EpisodeDetailScreen.tsx
- Possibly add validation in src/utils/episodeValidation.ts
notes: Fixed on branch: feature/episode-end-timeline-editing (commit 116edb5). Accidentally pushed to main but reverted and moved to proper feature branch.

title: Run precommit checks and verify all tests pass
description:
Execute all precommit checks to ensure code quality and test coverage before pushing.

**Command:** npm run precommit

**This runs:**
1. ESLint with --max-warnings=0 (no warnings allowed)
2. TypeScript type checking (npx tsc --noEmit)
3. Full Jest test suite with coverage (npm run test:ci)

**Success criteria:**
- npm run precommit exits with code 0 (no errors)
- All ESLint checks pass with 0 warnings
- No TypeScript errors
- All Jest tests pass (100% pass rate)
- Tests pass in the container environment

**IMPORTANT:** Do not proceed to push or PR creation if this task fails. Fix all issues first.

**If tests fail:**
- Review error messages carefully
- Fix code issues
- Re-run npm run precommit until it passes

title: Add build-time exclusion for test helpers in production
description:
The testHelpers.ts file contains database reset functions that should never be included in production builds. While there's a runtime check, the file could still be bundled.

Current protection:
if (__DEV__ === false) {
  throw new Error('testHelpers.ts should not be imported in production builds');
}

This is insufficient as the code is still bundled.

Recommendation:
1. Add build-time exclusion in metro.config.js
2. Use blacklistRE or similar to exclude test files in production builds
3. Consider splitting testHelpers.ts into:
   - testHelpers.ts (safe utilities)
   - devTestHelpers.ts (dangerous dev-only functions)

Security impact: Medium - prevents accidental inclusion of test utilities in production

title: Fix validation error when removing all pain locations via Log Update
Fix or document skipped tests in BackupRecoveryScreen
description:
There are 7 skipped tests in BackupRecoveryScreen.test.tsx that need to be either fixed or properly documented.

Skipped tests:
- should display backup list when backups available
- should display backup actions for each backup  
- should not render backups with invalid IDs
- should call restore backup when restore button pressed
- should call export backup when export button pressed
- should show error when export fails
- should show delete confirmation when delete button pressed

Root cause: Async lifecycle issues with component unmounting during test execution.

Options:
1. Fix the underlying async issues in the tests
2. Convert to E2E tests for proper lifecycle testing
3. Add TODO comments explaining the technical blockers

Improve daily check-in notification reliability with 30-day scheduling
description: Current implementation cancels the daily recurring notification when day status is logged, but this means notifications won't fire if user doesn't reopen the app. Future improvement: switch to scheduling 30 individual DATE-based notifications instead of one DAILY recurring notification. Top up on any interaction (app open, notification tap, action tap). This ensures notifications continue even if app isn't opened for extended periods.

title: Add E2E tests for BackupRecoveryScreen - Broken backup detection and cleanup

Add E2E tests for BackupRecoveryScreen - Restore, export, and delete actions
Add integration tests for critical user flows
description:
Current tests focus on unit-level screen testing but miss integration scenarios that test full user workflows across multiple screens.

Missing integration test coverage:
- Navigation flows between screens
- Data persistence across screen transitions  
- Store synchronization with database changes
- Full medication logging flow (list â†’ detail â†’ log â†’ confirmation)
- Episode creation and management flow
- Backup and restore full workflow

Recommendation:
1. Create integration test suite separate from unit tests
2. Test complete user journeys, not just individual screens
3. Verify data consistency across the entire flow
4. Use real store and database (test db) instead of mocks

Priority flows to test:
1. Log medication from notification â†’ dashboard update
2. Create episode â†’ add logs â†’ end episode
3. Create backup â†’ delete data â†’ restore backup

title: SettingsScreen.tsx: improve from 65.14% to >70% coverage
notes: Improved from 65.14% to 68.04% coverage by adding comprehensive error handling tests, navigation tests, and additional error condition coverage. Added 8 new test cases covering developer mode toggle errors, additional error handling paths, and edge cases.

title: Daily check-in notifications fire even with active migraine episode
description: The daily 'How is your day?' notifications are showing even when there's an active migraine episode. The code in dailyCheckinService.ts:33-44 is supposed to suppress the notification when episodeStore.currentEpisode exists, but this doesn't seem to be working correctly. Possible causes: 1) Race condition where currentEpisode isn't loaded when the check happens, 2) The notification is scheduled before the episode is created and not cancelled when episode starts, or 3) The handleDailyCheckinNotification handler isn't being called properly. Users shouldn't get 'How is your day?' prompts when they already have an active migraine logged.
